title: 112_hr3351
content: The Act titled "Franchise Education for Veterans Act" allows the use of educational assistance for franchise training. The GI Bill now includes various education programs for individuals not on active duty, such as apprenticeship, on-job training, cooperative programs, and training programs. The GI Bill offers education programs for individuals not on active duty, including apprenticeship, on-job training, cooperative programs, and approved training programs for franchises. The amount of educational assistance for these programs is subject to limitations. Educational assistance under this chapter for a training program at a specified establishment shall be the lesser of the fees assessed by the establishment or a monthly housing stipend. The monthly housing stipend for a member with dependents in pay grade E-5 residing in a specific military housing area is $83 for educational costs. The entitlement charged is $15,000. The monthly housing stipend for a member with dependents in pay grade E-5 residing in a specific military housing area is $83 for educational costs. The entitlement charged for a training program is $15,000, with specific rules on the number of months charged and the maximum payment allowed. The Secretary adjusts educational assistance amounts based on entitlement differences. Veterans are limited to 12 months of educational assistance under this subsection. The Post-9/11 GI Bill is amended to include approved programs and franchise training opportunities. The Post-9/11 GI Bill is amended to include training programs at approved establishments, with amounts for fees assessed during the training period. The Post-9/11 GI Bill now includes a monthly housing stipend for training programs at approved establishments, equivalent to the basic allowance for housing for a member with dependents in pay grade E-5. The Post-9/11 GI Bill now includes a monthly housing stipend of $83 for each month for dependents in pay grade E-5 residing in the military housing area. The Post-9/11 GI Bill provides educational assistance for training costs up to $15,000 per month, or a pro rata amount for partial months, for books, supplies, equipment, and other educational expenses. For individuals eligible under specific sections, the amounts payable are determined accordingly. The educational assistance for veterans under the Post-9/11 GI Bill is determined by multiplying the amounts specified in the clause by the same percentage applicable to monthly payments. A veteran cannot receive more than 12 months of educational assistance or exceed a total amount of assistance under this subsection. The Post-9/11 GI Bill provides educational assistance for veterans, with a maximum amount of assistance not exceeding $15,000. Payments for training programs at specified establishments are made to the individual upon the Secretary's receipt of the amount payable. The Post-9/11 GI Bill provides educational assistance for veterans, with payments made to the individual upon the Secretary receiving a certification of enrollment from the establishment.
